data.title: Nationals vs. Giants: Betting Preview for August 7
data.meta_description: On Wednesday, August 7 at 6:45 PM ET, the San Francisco Giants (57-58) visit the Washington Nationals (52-62) at Nationals Park. Blake Snell will get the nod for the Giants, while Jake Irvin will take the hill for the Nationals. The Giants (-159), according to sportsbooks, are moneyline favorites in this matchup against the Nationals […]
data.text:
Published 5:24 am Wednesday, August 7, 2024

On Wednesday, August 7 at 6:45 PM ET, the San Francisco Giants (57-58) visit the Washington Nationals (52-62) at Nationals Park. Blake Snell will get the nod for the Giants, while Jake Irvin will take the hill for the Nationals.

The Giants (-159), according to sportsbooks, are moneyline favorites in this matchup against the Nationals (+135) The total for this matchup is 8. The odds to eclipse the over are -105, while the odds are -115 to go under.

Email newsletter signup

Place your bets on any MLB matchup at BetMGM, and sign up with our link for a first-time deposit bonus!

Nationals vs. Giants Game Info

Date: Wednesday, August 7, 2024

Time: 6:45 PM ET

Location: Washington D.C.

Venue: Nationals Park

TV Channel: MASN

Live Stream: Watch this game on Fubo

Watch MLB, other live sports and more on Fubo! Use our link to sign up for a free trial.

Matchup Betting Info

Moneyline Favorite: Giants -159

Moneyline Underdog: Nationals +135

Over/Under: 8 runs (Over: -105, Under: -115)

Bet on this or any MLB matchup at BetMGM

Nationals Probable Starting Pitcher

The Nationals will hand the ball to Irvin (8-9) for his 24th start of the season.

The right-hander last pitched on Friday, when he gave up four earned runs and allowed six hits in 5 2/3 innings against the Milwaukee Brewers.

He has earned a quality start 13 times in 23 starts this season.

Irvin will look to pitch five or more innings for the fourth start in a row.

He has five appearances with no earned runs allowed in 23 chances this season.

Rep your team with officially licensed MLB gear! Head to Fanatics to find jerseys, shirts, and much more.

Nationals Hitting & Pitching Performance

The Nationals rank last in Major League Baseball with just 93 home runs as a team.

Washington ranks 24th in the majors with a .376 team slugging percentage.

The Nationals’ .243 batting average ranks 15th in the league this season.

Washington ranks 16th in the majors with 487 total runs scored this season.

The Nationals have the 15th-ranked on-base percentage in MLB this season (.312).

The Nationals rank sixth in MLB in strikeouts per game with an average of 7.6 whiffs per contest.

Washington pitchers have a combined ERA of 4.39 ERA this year, which ranks 24th in MLB.

Washington averages the 23rd-most strikeouts per nine innings (8.2) in the majors this season.

The Nationals have a combined WHIP of 1.322 as a pitching staff, which ranks 24th in MLB.
